item.title: The Sims 4: The Scare Seeker Lot Challenge Guide
item.description:
The Scare Seeker Lot Challenge is one of the rewards obtained from completing some of the tasks in the new limited-time event in The Sims 4 which will end on November 19, 2024. Players must start the Reaper’s Reward Event from the main menu to participate in the challenge.

While completing various tasks related to the Grim Reaper and learning how to make Ambrosia in The Sims 4 , you will eventually obtain the Scare Seeker Lot Challenge. It might take some time, but just be patient and complete the given missions to get the desired rewards.

How To Start The Scare Seeker Lot Challenge In The Sims 4

Upon creating a Sim and moving into a house in The Sims 4 , enter build mode and click on the Venue Info button (the house with an exclamation mark found in the top left corner). Choose the Traits Panel , then click on the trophy icon and choose the Scare Seeker Lot Challenge in The Sims 4 .

The challenge isn’t really ‘challenging’ as it mainly helps Simmers get rid of their Scared or Terrified Moodlets. If you are living on a normal Residential Lot , the gameplay will be normal, and you might forget the challenge is even active. However, if players choose to live on a Haunted Residential Lot , then they will have no problem talking to spirits and getting spooked as the Scare Seeker Lot Challenge completely overshadows the Terrified Moddlets by an Energized One. You can now even challenge Temperance without feeling the effect of her powers. This effect also applies to other fears such as being scared of thunderstorms.

On a side note, sometimes Sims visiting your Lot will give you useful gifts like a Skill book or a type of flower, and thank you for the 'good scare'.

How To Get The Scare Seeker Lot Challenge In The Sims 4

The Scare Seeker Lot Challenge is earned by completing a couple of tasks from the Reaper’s Reward Event. Make sure you are playing The Sims 4 online to trigger the event from the main menu. Upon entering any save, the Reaper’s event will be displayed in the top left corner.

You will be asked to complete many tasks throughout the weeks, like Ask the Spirits about Ambrosia, Cook a recipe while level 3 or higher, and Summon the Grim Reaper and each one will reward a certain number of Event Points. Once you have enough Points, claim the challenge from the Reward Event page and open the Traits Panel to activate the Scare Seeker Lot Challenge.

item.title: Monopoly GO: Free Dice Roll Links (Updated Daily)
item.description:
Monopoly GO is a fun board game that combines the classic Monopoly experience with cool additional features and a city-building element. In the game, players can move their pieces to earn money and then use that money to build new buildings, upgrade their houses, and much more. The ultimate goal is to drive other players into bankruptcy by acquiring all pieces of property, essentially creating a “monopoly.”

In Monopoly GO , players move according to the roll of dice they get, and the game proceeds with renting, trading, and buying properties. If players have finished their dice rolls and want to get some more, here’s how they can do it.

Updated by Umama Ali on Oct 21, 2024: Without dice, you can’t roll around the board, build landmarks, or participate in any tournaments. Running out of dice can slow down your progress in Monopoly GO , leaving you at a disadvantage compared to other players. To become the rightful tycoon, you need a steady supply of dice. We’ve updated this guide with a bunch of new links that offer free dice roll links so that you can keep building in Monopoly GO . Check back regularly to find new Monopoly GO links.

We discovered three new dice links on October 21. You can find all the active Monopoly GO dice links in the table below.

Free Monopoly GO Dice Links For Today

While your dice rolls slowly replenish over time, you can use Dice Links to get free dice rolls instantly. Dice Links are a quick and easy way to grab free dice and keep the action going in Monopoly GO .

Here are all the active Monopoly GO Dice Links for October 2024 to help you participate in ongoing events and tournaments and complete boards easily.

Monopoly GO Dice Links

Date

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 21 - Oct 24

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 20 - Oct 23

30 x Dice Rolls

Oct 20 - Oct 23

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 19 - Oct 22

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 17 - Oct 21

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 18 - Oct 21

25 x Dice Rolls

Oct 10 - Oct 21

25 x Dice Rolls

Sep 26 - Oct 28

Dice links can only be redeemed once per account . Additionally, links expire after a certain amount of time. If you click a link, and it says "This reward cannot be claimed", then that particular link is no longer valid.

Expired Monopoly GO Dice Links

  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls
  • 25 x Dice Rolls

How to Redeem Dice Links in Monopoly GO

To redeem these links, tycoons can follow these simple steps:

  • Open a link on your phone. This will launch the Monopoly GO app on your device.
  • All you need to do then is click 'Collect,' and you'll get dice rolls for free.

How to Get Free Dice Rolls in Monopoly Go

Login Daily

Like most mobile games nowadays, Monopoly GO also offers incentives for players so that they frequently play the game. One of the daily treats is free dice rolls, so logging in daily is one way to get them. In addition to dice rolls, players have the chance to win other exciting prizes as well.

Invite Friends

Monopoly GO offers generous rewards for players who successfully invite others to join the game. If a player invites a friend, and the invited friend joins the game, both of them get 30 extra rolls . Players can keep getting 30 free rolls for inviting up to 30 friends , given that they accept the invitation.

Collect Community Chest Rewards

Community chests are great because they offer a variety of rewards. Players can open these chests to earn money, and if they help a friend with a community chest, they can earn some free rolls.

To make the most out of the community chest, players must ensure that they have at least 9 active in-game friends.

Complete Sticker Albums

Players collect stickers throughout Monopoly GO , and they aren’t just a fun part of the game; they can help players get dice rolls , too. For every sticker set or album that players complete, they receive dice rolls. While the free rolls earned through sticker albums are more than those obtained after completing a set, the process of completing an album can be more time-consuming.

Participate in Events and Tournaments

If you want a bunch of dice rolls, consider participating in events and tournaments. The game introduces new events regularly, and by completing their milestones, you can claim dice rolls, different sticker packs, in-game money, and various other exciting prizes . Tournaments also pack a lot of stellar rewards, so players should aim to secure a high position on the tournament leaderboard to make the most of them.

Special Events

Apart from the main events and tournaments, Monopoly GO also has a number of special events. From Free Parking to Wheel Boost, the game offers many events to help you grab some dice rolls. However, their timings change every day, so you can check out our daily events schedule guide to know when they happen.

item.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio: How To Craft Masks
item.description:
Metaphor: ReFantazio has many unique Archetypes that have very different play styles or build styles. One Archetype that will change the usual trends of Archetypes is the Masked Dancer, which has the ability to take on the elemental affinities of other Archetypes.

This is done using different Masks, which players will first need to craft using the experiment system in Akademia. This may all sound confusing since players will begin to collect Masks from combat earlier than they unlock the Masked Dancer; so here's a full breakdown of what you need to know about masks.

What To Do With Masks In Metaphor: ReFantazio

The Masks you'll start getting that have different Arcana in the name are crafting pieces used to make Archetype Masks. With these crafting material masks, you'll need to progress the story until you unlock the Masked Dancer Archetype, which will happen with the fifth party member joining and can't be missed. Once this has happened, visit Akademia to have More explain the experiments process. Using these Arcana Mask pieces, you can craft the Masks of any of your current available Archetypes that can then be equipped onto the character using the Masked Dancer Archetype.

You can only craft Masks of an Archetype you have already unlocked by ranking up followers.

To craft Masks, go to the Special Experiments section in Akademia, where you'll be given a list of Masks for all available Archetypes you currently have. The affinities for the mask will be listed in the description so you know exactly what you are making. You'll need multiple Arcana masks to make one Archetype Mask, and these experiments are final and can't be undone.

How To Change Masks In Metaphor: ReFantazio

The one downside to Masks is that they take the accessory slot for that character. Junah will start with the Seeker Mask equipped, and other masks can be crafted and equipped on just like changing her accessory. Changing the Mask of that character will change their affinity to match that of the Archetype the Mask is named after. It is not required for a character using the Masked Dancer to have a Mask equipped, as they can also choose to equip another accessory and have the base affinities for the Masked Dancer.

Where To Get Masks In Metaphor: ReFantazio

The Arcana Mask pieces will mostly be obtained through combat and exploration throughout dungeons. They do have set locations in dungeon floors and in chests , meaning there is a limited number to find naturally in the game. Many enemies in dungeons found after Brilehaven will also randomly drop Masks, though this won't be a reliable method to get the masks you want.

Masks can also be purchased in a few select stores in the game. Both of these stores have rotating stock based on the in-game day of the week you visit, with one being in Virga Island, unlocked after the events at the Dragon Temple. The other shop can be accessed though the mask inventory needs to be unlocked.

  • Purchase "Secret Of The Eugief's Stall" for 1,000 Reeve at the Virga Island informant.
  • Visit the Wary Shopkeep on Seabreeze Street in Brilehaven.

item.title: Throne And Liberty: Danger Within Peace Exploration Codex Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Complete Danger Within Peace
    • Defeat Starlight Firefly At Night
    • Defeat Pirate King's Chest Crab
    • Collect A Page Of Collection: To Pirate King Adelico

The Codex system in Throne and Liberty can be a little weird, as the areas in which the quests have to be completed can be at a higher level than the requirement to start the quest itself. This can make finishing these missions a little tougher, since players may be fooled into expecting the quest to be easy to finish and are met with enemies hitting far harder than they may have expected. One such quest that falls into this category is Danger Within Peace.

Found in the Daybreak Shores area of the map, Danger Within Peace requires players to be in their mid-30s to start once they have activated the area using the Waystone. However, Daybreak Shores itself boasts a recommended level of at least 38 to survive. This rings true, as even being one level under 38 makes things way more difficult than they need to be. Because of this, players need to be level 38 before they attempt this quest , even though it unlocks before that. It just makes the whole thing a much better experience. Once they have done that, they can follow this guide to complete the quest.

How To Complete Danger Within Peace

In this quest, players will have to complete three different objectives :

  • Defeat Starlight Firefly at Night
  • Defeat Pirate King’s Chest Crab
  • Collect a Page of Collection: To Pirate King Adelico

These are all pretty straightforward , though actually finding them is another story. Here are the best ways to complete these steps with ease.

Defeat Starlight Firefly At Night

The first objective can be done in the large blue circle on the game's map. If players warp to the Daybreak Shores area, the Waystone they'll arrive at is directly overlooking this area . Looking down on it at night, players can see a ton of Starlight Fireflies roaming around.

Players just need to jump down and defeat five of these flying insects . This is where being at least level 38 is key, as taking these on while also dealing with the numerous enemies around them can be next to impossible at a lower level.

If they are the recommended level, players will easily be able to take down five of these bugs to complete this step.

Defeat Pirate King's Chest Crab

Again, being at level 38 is important here, as this enemy can take a good amount of beating before it goes down. It can be found near the ship wreckage along the coast; luckily, there is a small blue circle that will show players exactly where it is.

Once found, players just need to unleash all their best Skills on the crustacean until it falls. It has some big hits that players can look to avoid and even block using their defense. It also helps if another player is along for the ride, since some smaller enemies can complicate matters as well.

Collect A Page Of Collection: To Pirate King Adelico

The final step of this quest can be completed through different methods as long as players pick up a page from this specific collection . There are several littered around Daybreak Shores that can easily be found.

For this guide, players can use the image above to locate a page that is in the same area as the Starlight Fireflies for the first step of the quest. Picking it up will bring the quest to a close.

item.title: Batman: Arkham Shadow Confirms Surprise Actor for Scarecrow
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Elijah Wood will play Scarecrow in Batman: Arkham Shadow.
  • The game is set after Arkham Origins with young Bruce Wayne and iconic villains.
  • This is Wood's first major motion capture work for gaming, bringing Scarecrow to life in VR.

The newest upcoming Batman game, Batman: Arkham Shadow , will see Elijah Wood take on the role of the villainous Dr. Jonathan Crane, better known as Scarecrow, following a recent reveal. The casting announcement came just days before Batman: Arkham Shadow is set to release on October 22 exclusively for the Meta Quest 3 and 3S platforms.

A fan-favorite superhero universe is making a major return with Batman: Arkham Shadow, which will see players take on the role of the caped crusader in virtual reality, putting the fate of Gotham directly in their hands. The game is set shortly after the prequel title Batman: Arkham Origins and sees a younger Bruce Wayne return to take on some iconic bad guys like the Rat King and, of course, Scarecrow.

Now, as Batman: Arkham Shadow gears up for release on the Meta Quest 3 and 3S on October 22, fan-run YouTube channel Batman Arkham Videos revealed in a Q&A video that Elijah Wood will be taking on the role of Scarecrow in the game. While many of the game's voice actors, like Roger Craig Smith as Batman and Troy Baker as Harvey Dent, have been known for a while, Scarecrow's casting surprised many due to his iconic status in Hollywood.

Eiljah Wood Makes His DC Debut as Arkham Shadow's Scarecrow

Wood is perhaps best known for his role as Frodo Baggins in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, along with many other major Hollywood roles, though he does have a decent tenure as a video game voice actor as well. Most notably, he portrayed the titular protagonist in the Legend of Spyro trilogy, which began in 2006, and he has even reprised his role as Frodo in multiple Lord of the Rings video games in the mid-2000s.

In any case, however, Scarecrow will seemingly be a much larger role for Wood, as he mentioned in his brief segment of the video that it was his first time doing motion capture work for a major gaming project. The video even provided a brief clip of the actor donning full motion capture gear as he seemingly taunts Batman in what appears to be one of the iconic scenes that play when the player is defeated in the Batman: Arkham series.

While the "Arkhamverse," as fans have dubbed it, went on a long hiatus following the release of Batman: Arkham Knight in 2015, it made a controversial return in Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League earlier this year. Now, however, fans have a chance to jump in again as the Dark Knight, as Batman: Arkham Shadow brings the fan-favorite universe back once more, putting players in the shoes of Bruce Wayne in first-person virtual reality.
